conclusion: Solve step-by-step to find maximum distance between Cars A and B when side by side.
Car A has constant velocity of 40 m/s; Car B starts at 0 m/s with constant acceleration, velocity increases linearly.
Cars are side by side at t = 30 s.
Car B's velocity function is v_B(t) = 2t m/s.
Position functions: x_A(t) = 40t + C_A, x_B(t) = t² + C_B.
C_A = C_B - 300 derived from side by side condition at t = 30 s.
Cars are side by side at t = 10 s and t = 30 s.
Position functions simplified: x_A(t) = 40t - 300, x_B(t) = t².
Maximum distance occurs at t = 20 s.
Maximum distance between Car A and Car B is 100 meters at t = 20 seconds.
